website_summaries.verdict: A well-rounded product with an affordable price tag, this cooling fan provides deluxe accessories at a fraction of the cost.
pros: Shaped to elevate laptop for ease of use
Includes an anti-slip band, which keeps your laptop firmly in place
Soft border feels nice on wrists and forearms
LED indicator informs user when cooler is running
cons: Fan can be a bit noisy
Only fits laptops up to 15 inches well

customer_reviews.title: A/C for Your Computer!
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I looked at a lot of cooling pads before picking this one. I like that this pad can sit on your lap or a blanket, and that air can still circulate from the sides. Even with two fans running, it is extremely quiet. I like the fact that it uses a USB cord and switch to power the unit from the back and not the bottom, so that the cord and switch will not get damaged. The additional USB port is a nice bonus. Works well with my 13" Macbook Pro, keeps everything cool.
customer_reviews.author: WestieBoys

customer_reviews.title: This cooling pad is everything I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This cooling pad is everything I was looking for. I work in the IT field and though I don't repair laptops anymore, I know how bad it gets when the fans are sucking in air from the bottom, which most laptops still do so today and most of the laptop cooling pads are doing as well. Not this guy, I really like the functional design of this cooling pad. It sucks the air from the sides, the bottom is solid and has an air gap that leaves your lap, or whatever you set this on, cool and comfortable. It doesn't try to suck up hot pillow air if you set it on a pillow. This thing really works great.
customer_reviews.author: B. Morris

customer_reviews.title: USELESS
customer_reviews.text: It's literally two of the weakest fans blowing air around, and around means the sides of the pad. Nothing is going up to my computer. My computer heat hasn't decreased at all. It would be more effective to get a $5 fan from a store and blowing it onto your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap , ineffective toy
customer_reviews.text: I am quite disappointed in the cheap quality of this cooling pad. The reviews led me to think this was a good product. I’ll keep it because returning it is more trouble than its worth. The air flow is minimal. The lights cannot be turned off independently of the two small fans. My recommendation is for you to look to a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Home Chef

customer_reviews.title: Nice quiet cooling pad!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cooling pad, it is quiet and fits my Toshiba laptop perfectly. Gives it a slight tilt forward which I also like. Another plus is that if the computer is shut down the pad also shuts down whether or not you remember to flip its switch off. All in all I can't think of any negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Moran

customer_reviews.title: 100% Trash
customer_reviews.text: 4.3 out of 5 stars??? Whoever writes positive reviews for products like this has no idea what they are talking about. This fan is garbage and you are putting your laptop at risk by using it. It is quiet because it barely pushes any air. It is lightweight because it is cheap plastic. The grip strip at the front does absolutely nothing. The surface is so slick you are putting your laptop at risk by using it. Find a better option that will actually hold your laptop in place and cool it by you know... pushing air. I equate the air this moves to one of those tiny battery powered hand held fans you hold up to your face. Terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Lucky13

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but definitely a great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was definitely better than the previous one I purchased. The previous one I purchased had 4 fans, but this one worked better at decreasing the temperature of my laptop. Definitely recommend this product over the other cooling pads. Fan is almost completely silent, which is awesome. Not the best for gaming but definitely better than other products at this price. Although this product is not perfect, it is definitely worth purchasing. Overall, I am pretty satisfied with this product and will definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a decent cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Zarina

customer_reviews.title: Increases performance
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this laptop cooling pad. I had been resting my laptop on a pillow in my lap while watching television. The computer would occasionally get so hot it would power down. I use some processor hungry applications on a regular basis Without the cooling pad it would often reach 97% processor utilization Now, by using the cooling pad it is reduced to 50% or below. I keep the pad running 24 hours a day. It is very quite and after using it for a week my system has not powered down once!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael James

customer_reviews.title: Weird smell
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cheaply made but I wasn't under the assumption that it would be made out of anything other than cheap plastic. What makes me write this review is the smell-- every time I turn it on there's this noxious smell that hurts my throat. It smells like burning but the pad isn't hot. No idea what it is and have no opinions on its cooling power, but that smell makes me never want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: L B

customer_reviews.title: Side feed allows it to actually be on your lap.
customer_reviews.text: One of the few I could find that would actually allow it to sit on my lap since it feeds the air out the side. My laptop is a gaming laptop but the fans sit directly on the bottom so the fans get covered by my legs. It also gets very hot when it is at full tilt at ultra settings on a game. This actually allows me to sit on the couch or wherever with my laptop and not have any fans covered. Keeps my laptop very cool. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ragenasian

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs: it's a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Almost 4,000 ratings at 4.4 average stars. So, I bought into the hype and bought two of these. What an extreme disappointment! Let me put it this way, my 10-year-old cooling pad was quieter and blew more air than this piece of junk. My old cooling pad still manages to bring down my laptop's temps by an average 3-4 degrees while this sorry excuse for cooling pad couldn't manage even a single degree of cooling. And that's just me using a couple of apps and a browser. Don't waste your money here. These are being returned post-haste.
customer_reviews.author: Amon Ra

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok
customer_reviews.text: The fan on this Cooling Pad is very quiet. Other than that, there is nothing great about this cooling pad. There is very, very, very, very, I mean very little air flow. If I am running Zoom and other apps at the same time, by MacBook Pro still gets hot and the fan runs a lot more. The cooling pad is elevated, so that does provide some additional air flow. All that being said, it's just an ok cooling pad.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Quiet, Cools and Will NOT Damage Your Clothing
customer_reviews.text: The Tecknet cooling unit is a great product. With one hand, I can pick up the Tecknet unit and 13" MacBook Pro, without breaking the cooling unit. (With my last cooler, the plastic frame would fracture and usually jam a cooling fan.) This unit is solid and well designed. The fans are located at the back, where the processors generate heat. The fans are large enough to also cool the batteries, which are usually located at the front of your laptop. Finally, this cooler has no sharp edges or loose parts. This cooler has NEVER caught my clothing nor pulled a "run" in my clothing. This is the cooling unit to buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Mac

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my gaming laptop cool!
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews say it doesn't keep their laptops cool, some say it has a chemical smell etc. I must've gotten an updated version because mine keeps my gaming laptop very very cool and I smell nothing wrong. My laptop obviously gets very warm while I'm editing 4K video or playing GTA V. This pad is perfect because it keeps my monster of a CPU cool while I've got it running in high performance mode at 3.5ghz for hours on end. If it works for mine, I can GUARANTEE it'll work for yours. I7 6700HQ 16gb RAM 4gb GTX 960m graphics
customer_reviews.author: dannyphoto

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and cools well.
customer_reviews.text: My last computer "fried" because I left it running to long with a paper blocking the cooling intake. I don't want that to happen again. This fan is quiet. With intake areas on both sides, it is much less likely to be blocked. I also like the slight height it adds when using it on regular tables.
customer_reviews.author: K Doman

customer_reviews.title: This Fan Does Nothing to Cool Your Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one to replace my current unit which has prongs to keep the laptop from sliding down which are uncomfortable. This one does stay well, but the fan does ABSOLUTELY nothing to cool my laptop. With my other fan unit, the laptop would be cool to the touch even during heavy usage, with this one, it's as hot as it is without a fan. Absolutely returning, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: clz

customer_reviews.title: Smelly!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I turned it on it smelled strongly of machine oil, to the point where I almost gagged. It's a good thing I wasn't inviting anyone over or I might have had to throw it out. The lights are also annoying as i got this for a work computer and will probably have to rip them out to make it professional. I would have rather bought one without the lights to save myself the trouble but there aren't any that don't cost more than double the price. The fans seem to work fine otherwise and keep my laptop cool even when performing complex calculations or otherwise under heavy load. It's comfortable enough on my lap, even without pants.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: My wife was complaining that her laptop was getting to hot. I recommended a cooling pad and The TeckNet seemed like the perfect fit for her environment. It arrived as promised and has been in use every since. My only complaint, if I had to have one is that I would prefer that it came with a power adapter so that it would tie up one of her USB ports, she only has 2. Otherwise I expect it to run without issue for a long time. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: George Antochy, COL (retired), USAR,

customer_reviews.title: Plastic stinks incredibly bad
customer_reviews.text: It serves its purpose of giving my laptop something to sit on, but the plastic smells so bad I literally had to leave it in another room because the smell was overpowering my bedroom. It's ridiculously bad. I tried wiping it down with a disinfectant wipe, but that didn't help. I might try covering it with some febreeze later. I wouldn't recommend this product. God only knows what's in this plastic or where it comes from. It's probably giving me cancer as it sits on my lap. The fans only serve to push the smell around. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: AriTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Failed expectations
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes that this cooling pad would help with my Asus laptop CPU overheating issues, but the change was negligible. Running games on the i7 Gen 8 can bring the CPU temp up to 82-83, and this cooler only drops the temp about 2-3 degrees. Sure the fans are quiet but that's due to the low RPM - They just don't move enough air to be effective. When you put your hand to them you can barely feel anything. Also, the non slip pad doesn't seem to have any impact, as the laptop slides forward even with a slight angle. Bottom line, for gaming i would definitely seek another solution.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but...
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product out of the box; the build quality is good, and that's one thing I was worried about. It seems to work correctly, I'll see how warm my laptop gets compared to the past. One gripe I have is that while the product description and in-product documentation refers to "adding" a 2-port USB hub, you have to use one of them to power the unit, so you really only get 1 additional USB port to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mack Yooser

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great! I bought two, one for my laptop and one for my daughter who is now being home schooled. My computer used to get warm playing games and when I worked for long periods of time, but not anymore. It is the perfect size. I have a 15 inch computer and my daughter has a 14 inch one. It fits great on both. Very quiet and runs off your computer.
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaA

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my small laptop.
customer_reviews.text: This works well, the laptop is stable and comfortable to use at the angle. I normally use it at a table, but I have used it in my lap and that works well, too. The one drawback is the smell! It is slowly improving, but it started out smelling awful. This was not a problem I had even imagined. I am not particularly sensitive to chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Great value cooling pad.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for almost 2 years. Price is good for comparable cooling pads. Pretty quiet, but the cable goes 90 degrees straight into the back of the cooling pad, in the middle, which makes it very inconvenient to use if I put it in my lap. The USB cable also stopped working consistently after a year. I bought a new USB to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Olive

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit loud but works great! My previous model had a nice cushioned bottom which I miss on this one but otherwise it works well. I don’t game but I’m a full time student so I work on pc for long stretches & this immediately kills the fan if it comes on. I hope it lasts as long as my last one which survived 3 years. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: Here's the thing...I don't think it provides a whole lot of cooling, but it does help move hot air away from the laptop so it's worth it, even if it's a small amount. I really only bought this because I like to watch movies in bed and my laptop gets really hot on my sheets. This is also great if in bed and having the laptop on your lap. Definitely not mad I bought this, it had made using my computer more pleasant. Big con is that I don't know that I would travel with it. It's made out of extremely cheap and weak plastic. I can bend it by squeezing my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: TruSpadez

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable, but with notable flaws
customer_reviews.text: This cooling pad will indeed cool! I don't have any problem with heat while using it, and it makes working with my laptop on my lap a good deal more tolerable. HOWEVER! It's not particularly comfortable, since it's just bare plastic in your lap. And, most annoyingly, the rubber grip at the bottom that's clearly meant to keep your laptop from slipping down doesn't work at all. I can barely angle this in my lap beyond being totally flat before my laptop start slipping down. That's honestly the biggest issue I have with it and the reason I'll be looking for other options.
customer_reviews.author: Taryn

customer_reviews.title: Very Weak Fan - Sort of Works
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with a Thinkpad Yoga for about 2 years. It was never all that strong but worked well enough that I didn't look for another one. However the dual fans, which were never terribly good, have gotten weaker slowly over time. They don't make much noise and I've taken it apart to clean it twice but it really makes no difference. I'd give it 3 stars I suppose, but I'm rounding to 2 star for the cheap build quality and because, frankly, it's *only* job is to provide airflow and it does that rather poorly.
customer_reviews.author: EyewandersTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Still works.
customer_reviews.text: Been almost a year and I have had no issues. My laptop runs VERY hot when playing games which is regrettably what lead me to just buying a desktop later on. However, until I got around to doing that I used this with my laptop for almost a year. It definitely makes a difference and prevented my game from stuttering because of the heat. However, my computer still got quite hot but noticeably cooler with this. For the price, I think it's certainly adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Evangale

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for gaming laptops
customer_reviews.text: The lights are a nice touch, but I feel like this hasn't really benefited the performance of my laptop. I have a Razer Blade 15, and even when I'm not gaming, this doesn't really keep the laptop all that cool. Also, the slits on the side to draw in cool air seem a bit too open. It always makes me hesitant on unplugged cables from the side of my laptop because it can easily go into the slits and hit the spinning fans.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey V

customer_reviews.title: It does what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Cons: This thing isnt the greatest. The fans are really really slow but still somehow make quite a bit of noise. It has a smell coming off of it like they used toxic chemicals to make the thing. Pros: It gets the laptop off the ground so the air flow is better. My performance gains were minimal but I bought this to eek out every last ounce of performance out of my gaming laptop as possible and It as a positive impact so im happy their. The look is very pleasing to me, unlike most of competition.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Not the best laptop cooling stand but it does everything it is supposed to do just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the intended purpose. A light light on the design. It is a bit ugly, but it sits under the laptop out of sight so who really cares. Would like it to turn off with the computer so I don’t have to remember to switch it off manually every time I shut down. Not too important but why not more USB ports? It says it has 2 but one of them gets used to power the fans so it really only has 1 USB port you can use for other devices.
customer_reviews.author: ArranMF

customer_reviews.title: Just what my laptop asked for!
customer_reviews.text: Love this laptop cooler already and only had a short time. Price was great (Black Friday) and it is sooooo quiet & keeps my laptop cool (don't know how it survived without it). Touched laptop underneath when I turned it off and not even warm. The blue lights are a nice addition, too! Highly recommend this cooler...you won't be disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: wpb7

customer_reviews.title: The fans do work
customer_reviews.text: This unit will keep your laptop cool if you have air inlets in the bottom of the case. One thing i do not like is the inability of the surface to keep the laptop from sliding around. I did not rate it for gaming as I do not play online games. It is a very quiet unit, it has an extra USB port in the back next to the switch and if you are placing this unit on a table top or in your lap and are not moving around too much, you will be fine.. It will take some experimenting for me to find a way to keep my laptop from sliding around too much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You Can't Go Wrong!!
customer_reviews.text: It's working fine for now so I give it a good review. The price is good and it keeps my laptop cool and functioning great, it's good that when I forget to cut it off it turns off when my computer shuts down. It's easy to use in bed and my laptop doesn't slide off thanks to the grips at the bottom of the pad. My only problem is the rubber feet at the underside of the pad are coming off so I took away stars because of that. It's still a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: free4lyfe

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing has been a godsend! My MacBook Air is old, and it gets really hot when I use it for extended periods of time, which is really bad for the battery life. Using this TechNet fan underneath it has completely resolved that problem. I have sound sensitivity, and fortunately it’s not very loud at all. It’s very light weight, and I always take it with my computer. It’s also much more comfortable to have my computer up a little higher. I should’ve bought this a long time ago!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex :-)

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my MSI laptop. It's got an Nvidia 1060 GTX with 6gb of video ram, so it puts off a LOT of heat when gaming. Using this tray means I can actually keep it on my lap. The fans aren't really very powerful, as one video review showed, but the point is to assist in air flow for the internal fans of the laptop, which it does well. And it's very quiet. I often forget to turn it off. This is the only cooling pad I've ever tried, so I have nothing else to compare it to. But I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Alberts

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but I was disappointed and returned it
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that the incline would help position the laptop on my lap and that feature did work. However, the surface of the cooling pad is really slippery and the laptop would not stay on the cooling pad, slipping into my belt buckle and needed to be continuously moved back into position. I tried reversing the pad to use the tilt in another way to no avail. Too slippery. It seemed strong enough, well made enough and quiet, but not good for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Stout

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and effective.  Saved my laptop from overheating!
customer_reviews.text: This cooling pad saved my laptop purchase! I was upset with how hot my HP Envy was getting and I was ready to return the laptop, but I decided to give this cooling pad a try and it works like a charm. I can do my homework in bed and not worry about starting a fire. I love the cooling pad plugs right into the USB, so you only need to keep your laptop charged (or charging) for it to work. It's not loud at all, in fact, it's so quiet that I forget to turn it off sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Renner

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly QUIET!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how quiet the fan is on this cooling pad. Just returned another brand as the motor was so loud I had to turn the TV up higher. It very comfortable on my lap and the fan is so whisper quiet I often have to check to see if it's on. I love that it also has an on/off switch. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: A nice basic cooler, nothing fancy, but lightweight, seems sturdy, is very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is a good size, not oversized. It is good for our 2 laptops, a 13-inch and a 15.5 inch, without a lot of width you don't need. It sits comfortably on my lap, and the laptop is not slipping. Very quiet. In the last 2 years, I have had 2 different laptop coolers that failed. One failed in less than 3 months. I will see how this one holds up. I was going to buy a second one, but the price already went up 10 per cent since I bought the first one. The pricing variations are annoying. But that has nothing to do with the quality of the cooling pad.
customer_reviews.author: Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Really weak air flow
customer_reviews.text: The product looks good and is comfortable. The non-slip strip is handy and the air vents to the side is good for keeping the heat off your legs. There is only one problem, there is barely enough airflow to move a piece of paper off the fans. That's a deal breaker. The one thing a laptop cooler is supposed to do is cool, this pad doesn't. The only purpose this item serves is to give you a place to sit your laptop. The cooling part doesn't exist so If your laptop runs hot, move on.
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product and Does Its Job!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased one of these for my Dell Latitude and it does a very good job of dispersing the heat. You plug its' USB connection into your computer and the fans spin very quietly and disperse the heat. It is also on a slight downward angle and slightly helps typing on the keyboard. However, it stopped working for some reason, but I liked it enough to order another one. Then wouldn't you know, it started working again, so I haven't used the new one. I guess I'll wait until it stops working for good before I use the new one.
customer_reviews.author: C Christensen

customer_reviews.title: the rubber strip, contrary to what others say, ...
customer_reviews.text: the rubber strip, contrary to what others say, does not, by any means prevent the laptop from sliding off the pad when used on your lap. It needs a raised edge of some sort near the front as unless you a re lifeless and motionless, you lap top will slide forward of the front of the cooling pad. Update 12-12-17: Cathy, an agent for the company, issued a $5.00 refund on this order in order to help ease my dissatisfaction with product. While it doesn't solve the problem, I do appreciate her and the companies willingness to make the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Jim P.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, proper sized and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: The cooling pad seems to be well made and the supplied USB cord was easy to connect up to my computer. I really like the power switch on the cooling pad so that I only need the fans to be on under heavy computer load. The cooling pad gets the air intake for my computer fans off of my lap - so the laptop fans can do their job adequately. However, the cooling pad fans supply the extra cooling when needed. The cooling pad is well sized for my 15 inch laptop and not way too large for my lap. I am well pleased with this cooling pad.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Martens

customer_reviews.title: I like that the pad has another USB port
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my targus pad which was several years old and making weird noises. I like that the pad has another USB port, this comes in handy as computers seem to have fewer USB ports every year. I also like that it can be switched on and off. However, depending on the placement of my macbook pro 15" on the pad, it sometimes makes a pretty loud rattling noise, which is annoying. I can usually move the computer around so it doesn't make the noise anymore - it sounds like the comptuer is pushing down on a piece that then makes the noise). but this is annoying to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Fan was just ok, didn't cool that much, but just enough. The design prevents it from cooling near the edges because that part is covered, and which is where the laptop would actually get the hottest. It died within less than 7 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: AJB

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does its job well, though it feels on the flimsy side it isn't too bad; the fans are quite and push a lot of air. Great for netbooks and thin&lights that use the outer metal body of the laptop to dissipate heat. The usb passthrough works well with no noticable lag or latency
customer_reviews.author: Gun4hire

customer_reviews.title: Actually works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Our aging MacBook can start to run hot even just doing some browsing, listening to music and doing bills since it's processor is old. So I thought a cooling pad was worth a try to help keep the old, trusty MacBook limping along for the basic stuff I need it for. I was surprised that this thing actually works. It definitely keeps the temps down while that old processor is chugging along. So if you do a lot of processor heavy work or are like me and just trying to keep your old laptop around a little longer before you need to replace, a cooling pad like this is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: BS AZ

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the great price
customer_reviews.text: This product has exceeded my expectations, greatly improving the experience using my HP Spectre. Since the surface of the Tecknet pad is larger than my laptop, the extra space gives my wrists a rest and makes my laptop more comfortable to use, I would value this pad even without the cooling fans. And the fans /motor are nearly silent. If I didn't feel the gentle breeze of air, I would have to look at the light to know the product was on over the other ambient noises in my house. I am very happy with this product thus far, and the only thing that remains to be seen is what kind of lifespan it will have.
customer_reviews.author: no card on file

customer_reviews.title: Not cool enough
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to work for a little while but then once i started playing just overwatch my game lagged to 17fps on a razer blade stealth 13 inch. shouldnt do that at all due to heat. just not cool enough for me. i wouldnt mind more noise as i wear a headset most of the time its just not good enough at cooling down my laptop to even play overwatch
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Not silent and smells of cigarettes
customer_reviews.text: The cooling pad is a great concept, but this one doesn't seem to be good. The first thing I noticed when I turned it on was the sound. It's not silent at all. Although it's not super loud, it certainly doesn't warrant being called "quiet". After a few minutes of it running, it started smelling like stale cigarette smoke, almost like my grandmas house from when I was a kid. It's terrible. I'm going to try to have it run and air out for a while. It certainly is an unpleasant smell, and prolonged use would induce a headache. Yuck.
customer_reviews.author: atburrow

customer_reviews.title: Large fans and noise level is Zero.  20 STARS
customer_reviews.text: I'm not using this for gaming so I'm not sure how that is affected. I am using this to cool down my older laptop which tends to overheat. It is noiseless. 20 STARS Hopefully, it will last me at least a year or more. The last two I've purchased broke the first time I dropped them. Due to rickety stands. I decided to go with this one since it does not have an adjustable stand. but the fans are very large. Good stuff so far. ***Update on this....I bought a second one for work laptop since SIP. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Jlnicky

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: I can't hear it when it's running. Seems to keep my laptop cool for up to 4 hours at a time. Only downside is there's not a little lip or edge along the front, so the laptop sometimes slides down the incline. Works for my 14" laptop, but I think it would be too small for larger sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Very silent
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cooling pad, because my laptop's ventilator always started when having conference calls for more than 5 minutes. The cooling pad makes less noise than the original laptop ventilator and avoid the laptop's one to start. On the keyboard side it is slim enough to allow the keyboard use without having to lift the wrist. Good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Sonka

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the laptop cool even though it has a tendency to heat up. Diverts the hot air away from the lap and also keeps the laptop running cooler. Easy to setup and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Caufield

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this model because it has a power switch that allows you to turn it off when the laptop is not in use. I had to unplug my last one to get it to turn off when I turned off the computer. Also, the blue lights on the fans show that they are working. Plus, it sits the computer up high from the armchair of my recliner, so better circulation of air to keep the laptop cooler. It's my favorite so far from the three I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne H. Lundy, Author of The Girl from Nip 'n' Tuck

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter recently injured her knee and had to work from home for 2 weeks. Her laptop runs very hot, so she always needed to put a folded towel underneath it. Now with this cooling pad she doesn't need this towel anymore, her laptop feels much cooler to the touch and it serves sort of like a table - she was at first a bit skeptical but after using it for several days she totally loved it and even recommended it to a sister-in-law!
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my 15 inch laptop. My only complaint is I wish the fan placement had more variety - if my laptop is centered, my main exhausted vent isn't being ventilated. I love that it's always tilted and has the side vents, which means it works just as well when resting on furniture or carpet. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RetroDad

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy exterior, doesn't cool much
customer_reviews.text: Cons: The exterior (especially the underside) feels somewhat flimsy, and the lack of a front lip leaves the laptop sliding at certain angles. Most importantly, though, the minimal air flow doesn't seem to be cooling the laptop much. (The fans can blow aside a tuft of cat fur but not even a small bit of tissue.) Pros: The side openings seem nice in theory (though again, the fans aren't moving a lot of air overall). The underside is comfortable enough on my legs, and the fan is quiet.
customer_reviews.author: I. Rovang

customer_reviews.title: The on/off button is nice
customer_reviews.text: The reason I chose this one in particular is because you can keep it on your lap and block the bottom of it VS having to keep it clear bc that's where the fans pull the air to on the other models available. It works excellently and is quiet. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: The fans are noisy and do not work very well, I'm afraid. My previous method of putting ice packs beneath my laptop is more effective. I put my hand over the fans while they were running and the air itself was cool, but my laptop just wasn't having it. I am giving this two stars and not one because the pad itself is light and unobtrusive when I put my laptop on it. This seems to be a 'you get what you pay for' kind of situation, that or my laptop is just really stubborn. Also, it smells a little bad--like someone else's house??
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price decent output. Cool light. Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Think its helping! I plug it into an outlet though so its not drawing power from my outdated (2009) MacBook. Laptop works great but greats hot after gaming and then slows down. This product seems to help and hell, for the price I'd say it does the job. If I were to buy another cooling pad I personally would probably choose a more expensive product/More fan output ext, But, for the price I'm satisfied. Before spending a lot on a cooling pad ill probably just upgrade my computer USB cable provided is hella short but most will probably plug into the laptop to power it anyway Very lightweight plastic
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: My large 17" laptop fits great on this perfectly. It doesn't slide around but stays firmly in place. It is comfortable to use and type on. I use a program to monitor the internal CPU temps. With this turned on my laptop consistently stays 20-30 degrees cooler. After 4 months, one of the fans makes a terribly loud noise and visibly spins slower. I contacted customer service and they quickly replaced the unit. The new cooling pad is working perfectly. Great product and great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyJJ

customer_reviews.title: Keeps lap cool
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit. Found this unit to be perfect for my needs. Keeps my lap and laptop cool. I especially appreciate that the USB connector isn't hard-wired into the unit, so if it is accidentally pulled it disconnects without breaking. Like it so much I bought two more for my brother and sister-in-law. Update: 08/06/19. After a period of time the unit collects dust and causes the fans to make a noise as they spin. It is difficult to open the cooler in order to clear the dust. This is something that needs to be repeated from time to time. I imagine this would be a problem for any cooler of this design. Still works very well however.
customer_reviews.author: LouiseM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price
customer_reviews.text: The USB port is useful for peripherals, like a mouse or usb drive. It doesn't have a high data pass-through, though. I have a USB monitor that wouldn't consistently connect when connected that way, but since I have other ports, that's less an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ian B.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE YES
customer_reviews.text: I use this under my laptop and there is NOTHING to dislike about it. This might be the best ever little gadget I've purchased on Amazon. It keeps my over priced lame Dell laptop from igniting into flames. Thank you Thank you Thank you for making this product.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: overall good.
customer_reviews.text: My laptop has a history of overheating and shutting off suddenly. Ive been needing a fan for a long time. This works well for my laptop. Keeps it cool, and doesn't make much noise. i only wish it wasn't as bulky. I understand a fan needs to be a little thick, but I need it on my laptop almost all the time and heaving this around gets a bit tiring. I would probably add more grips to keep the device and fan secure. Not just on top, but beneath as well. i feel like they might slip from my hands sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: cassandra ruby

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: It works as described but it does affect my laptop battery life. I wish it had its own power supply with the option of powering it from that or the laptop. I find the usb plug in the back working like a bumper every time I slide it back towards the wall and the cord to be much too long but it is quiet and does have a power on off switch. My laptop stays in place and doesn't slide off. Overall Im satisfied with it and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great item! Helps my laptop remain cool even after ...
customer_reviews.text: Great item! Helps my laptop remain cool even after hours of playing online. The pad has nice rubber strip towards the bottom so the laptop will stay in place. Quickly plug in the USB and flip the switch on and you feel the difference. Does not make much noise. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Edited: It is working again. Apparently it needs to rest some times
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. I use my computer a lot and noticed yesterday that it had stopped working. I went to check out how to return and May 31 st was the window for return. That was YESTERDAY. dumb. Anyway, dont waste your money for a fan that wont last over a month.
customer_reviews.author: sweet jane

customer_reviews.title: Bring on the Chill
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to replace a 5 year old unit that had frayed wiring. I wanted a super quiet unit that did its job of cooling my laptop. I am extremely pleased with the low rumble of the fans and the fact that I can feel the cool air. The downside is, with this cool spring and our Iowa temperatures still in the 30's to 50's, my fingers gets a little chilly when I am not typing put have my hands on my desk top. Not a big deal but the fans are proving to me that they are cooling. This item was delivered on time and in great shape. I would certainly purchase another unit if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: Suspect build quality, good form factor
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two for the wife and I. One broke within two weeks. Doesn't do a ton to actively cool your laptop. But it is the perfect shape to keep a warm laptop off your lap or let it better ventalte itself when in bed. Also when it worked it was ultra quiet. Moral of the story, suspect build quality but still "functions" in keeping laptop elevated at correct angle when in bed or on couch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Noisy fan and bad smell, but cools well.
customer_reviews.text: This laptop cooling platform seems like a good idea, but its execution is flawed. One of the fans made both a clicking noise and a high pitch hum. Also, the plastic smelled like bad chemicals. The plastic seems to be very brittle and it would be easy for this cooling pad to break if accidentally dropped onto the floor. On the positive side, the fans do blow well and will help to cool your laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because my laptop was overheating and "freezing up. I've used it for about 2 months now. The angle of the table makes my laptop very comfortable to use. I thought that I would be annoyed by the blue light but I'm actually grateful for it; the fans are so quiet that I forget they are on. The light is a reminder to turn it off which is super easy with the toggle switch. It is keeping my laptop nice and cool. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check This One Out
customer_reviews.text: The fans do not light up, that's here nor there, just noticed a difference between pic and reality. This is a very comfortable, stable and useful fan. My old one would flex and hit the spinning blades, this one doesn't. It keeps my computer cool sending the air right into the cooling ducts and upon the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This may be the most useful sub $20 gadget ever. My smaller (13") laptop sits very low on my counter, lap, etc this gives it a little more height, a very useful angle and I am extremely impressed with the fans. The fans are ultra-quiet (as advertised and reviewed by others), keeps my lap and laptop very cool and hooked into the USB port, does it even use any battery? (if so, I haven't noticed). Highly recommend as a must have for those of us who sit in front of the TV at night and work, surf, etc
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Bain

customer_reviews.title: Laptop doesn't burn my legs any more.
customer_reviews.text: Air is circulating but I haven't spend any time figuring out how efficient the fans are. They are quiet. The unit is nice looking and well worth the $17 I paid from a manufacturing standpoint. My Mac seems to be running about 20 degrees cooler when using applications that normally cook the base of the MacBook. So, I'm happy. I'm about to upgrade RAM this weekend, so if any additional comments are warranted, I'll make them at that time. Overall, it's a product that is hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Greg T

customer_reviews.title: Works As Designed And Has Nice Cooling Effect.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the blue lights as a visual display to show the device is powered from a cosmetic and safety standpoint. The USB to laptop connector is on the back of the device which is more convenient for me as opposed to being on the side as I have seen on other devices I have used in the past. The unit is very quiet and provides a cooling effect for my laptop as well as my lap. I have not owned it long enough to give it 5 stars as durability is a metric I like to provide feedback on as well however that takes time.
customer_reviews.author: Keyven

customer_reviews.title: Best Laptop Cooling Device, EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of different cooling devices and they never lasted very long and weren't nearly the quality as they had advertised. When the Tecknet laptop cooler arrived, my first reaction was, "Wow! this thing is built to last" It's very, very quiet and works like a charm. It won't be the last product I but from the good folks at Tecknet. Thanks for a bargain at any price laptop cooler. Kudos to you.
customer_reviews.author: Power Down Media

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy fan
customer_reviews.text: The fan is very noisy.. Not sure if i got a defective piece. will be returning this
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Loving it! Cool & quiet!
customer_reviews.text: This new pad is keeping my computer cool which helps it run better. In addition to keeping my computer cool, it is keeping my legs cool as I hold my computer in my lap. It is very quiet which is something I was concerned about. Plus, I like the fact that it is very lightweight which makes it easy for me to take with me on the road. My last one was much bigger and heavier. Plus, it didn't have an on/off switch. This one is the perfect package! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Gina Carr

customer_reviews.title: Needs a stop piece, but does help cooling
customer_reviews.text: I've found my Dell Vostro 7500 does run cooler (and quieter) with this pad compared to a pad without fans. However, the other pad has a flip-up piece which stops the laptop from sliding forward, which this pad sorely needs. The strip on the bottom is not sufficient for my laptop. However, it's not terrible, just an inconvenience when I periodically push the laptop back up the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Fans are very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for a little over a month and it's working as expected. The fans are really quiet. Quiet enough to leave the fans on while you are using computer audio on a video or voice call. I will say that it feels cheaply built. I'm just extra careful with it when I'm handling it. I can't really comment on the durability yet, but after a year of use, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my laptop!!
customer_reviews.text: This cooling pad is fantastic. Depending on what kind of computer you have- where the air intake and vents are located- it is important to get the right kind of cooling pad. Some blow air up, some down. This works great for my Dell and seems to be the right kind. It cools and I think my laptop runs a little faster even. It is really quiet, more quiet than when my laptop is processing a lot of data, and I have had to look at the sides for the blue light to make sure it is on because it is that quiet. The rubber pads ensure my laptop doesn't slide at all.
customer_reviews.author: goodadvicegiver

customer_reviews.title: Best Cooling Pad while gaming
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cooling pad for my Dell G5 while gaming. This cooling pad fit the bill and worked excellent. The laptop stays on the pad and does not slip off. The cooling fans are very quiet - hardly noticeable. The pad helps keep my laptop cool. It also fits well on my lap. I wish it was a little wider that is my only complaint but it works ok. I like that I can turn the fans off when not gaming. I have well over 1000 hours of use and no complaints or breakage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, smells strong
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for wife’s work laptop. It works fine and is quiet, but it smells like when you first walk in a Harbor Freight store. It seems to be going away slowly though. Unless we’re just getting used to the strong Chinese factory scent.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepdog

customer_reviews.title: Great value, superior design, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: It has two USB ports in the back next to the on/off switch. It comes with a short USB cord to connect to the required a power source, presumably your laptop, notebook, etc. So quiet I can use it my classes with zero disturbance to my classmates. I need multiple USB ports so I just plug a multi USB power strip in the second port and I can add whatever I need at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Annoyingly loud. (Video included)
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that this item might be bulky, judging by the pictures, but it was surprisingly lightweight and fit perfectly under my 15.6” laptop. HOWEVER... I’ll be returning mine because there is a very noticeable ticking/grinding noise when the fan runs (video attached). I expected some fan noise, but the ticking is pretty annoying and not something I want to hear while working on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Phizak

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: This laptop cooling pad has worked very well for me. I recently attended a conference that included a workshop in which participants needed to bring their own laptops. I knew I'd have a heat issue with my laptop running for three solid hours, and this worked great. It even fit into my laptop carrying bag. It really isn't heavy at all, and it is pretty quiet. No one around me was bothered by the sound (and we were sitting very close together), so I was happy about that. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Moon in CA

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Cooling Pad Does its Job
customer_reviews.text: Have used for a month and a half now on a gaming laptop. I'm able to use the laptop for a couple of hours at a time without noticing any uncomfortable heat on my lap. I'm not sure if that's because the cooling pad is keeping the computer cooler or if the heat is just dissipating before it gets to me. Either way, the cooling pad is doing what I bought it for. It's also super quiet. I generally can't hear it running.
customer_reviews.author: Redogg

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought it sooner. My husband had to replace the fan in his laptop because his computer was always running hot, and the fan ran most of the time the computer was in use. This is a lot less money that the fan! It is quiet and works great, looks good. It is not bulky Most importantly, his laptop does not heat up. Excellent value. I gave it 4 stars because it hasn't been in use for more than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M

customer_reviews.title: Great fan cooling base for my laptops
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and profile for my 14 and 15 inch laptops. The air pressure seems adequate for my low end laptops. I'm not sure it would be enough if you had a laptop that ran hot. It has blue led lighting which I didn'feel I needed though i find I have a good visual indicator that it's powered on. The fans are quiet. Overall, for the price, I'm satisfied with how it works.
customer_reviews.author: James Zielinski

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. Not sure why it has the colors, as really it just stays under the laptop, but it seems to work fine and is quiet to use. Plugs right into the laptop, so I can move it as I move the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but a momentary noise is cause for concern
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this thing it was quiet, then for no reason it got really loud. I'm guessing there is play in the fans or molding variation when there could be some sort of interference. A quick smack made this thing quiet again. That was a week ago, still no noise.
customer_reviews.author: RunNGun74

customer_reviews.title: Great performance with very little noise! (while it lasts!)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I upgraded from a creaky ancient laptop cooler with tiny noisy fans. This fits my laptop perfectly and the big fans are very very quiet. Update: This lasted a little over a year, then I started noticing my laptop freezing up. I checked everything and it turned out that the fans where no longer spinning, so the laptop was overheating. When I unplugged the USB cable, then end was very hot. I tried plugging it into a powered USB hub and the whole hub shut down. Something is clearly fried.
customer_reviews.author: DadViking

customer_reviews.title: Best Laptop Cooler I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many laptop cooling pads and this one by far is my favorite! With the additional USB port it doesn't take away from the ports you have on your laptop. The laptop I am using this with is older and thus becomes more heated than many new ones (although new ones can use this too)! Great angle so that you are not typing on a laptop that is setting perfectly flat which helps prevent carpal tunnel! I nice soft light on the back (next to the on/off switch) gives you confirmation that it is running since it is so quiet you may miss any noise associate@
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bismarck

customer_reviews.title: Macbook Pro 2020 13"
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my 2020 macbook pro 13". If you own that laptop you will know the fans come on constantly. It cools it down and keeps the internal fans off unless I am doing heavy editing. Noise level could be quieter but it's fine given that I do voice over often without a mic. I like the open sides for handling the pad also. 4/5!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, not too big. Works well to keep my computer cool, although it's been less effective on REALLY hot days. That's not it's fault though. I like how the fans are covered so you can't accidentally shove your fingers in there. After a few weeks of using it, it has started to make a bit of noise sporadically. Light clicking. I shake it and it usually stops - maybe something is just caught in there?
customer_reviews.author: Shawna A.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be damned this thing actually works. I previously bought a different cooling adjustable desk thing that was janky so I was hesitant making a similar purchase (since you can’t trust reviews anymore). Im very happy with this item, it’s sturdy material, keeps my laptop cool and is quiet. I have sound sensitivity and so far this hasn’t engaged that. It is exponentially quieter than when the internal MacBook cooling system is running.
customer_reviews.author: shedaisy

product_meta.title: TECKNET Laptop Cooling Pad, Portable Ultra-Slim Quiet Laptop Notebook Cooler Cooling Pad Stand with 2 USB Powered Fans, Fits 12-16 Inches
feature_bullets: Tecknet Laptop Cooling Pad with a metal mesh surface provides excellent airflow to help keep your laptop, notebook, netbook, ultrabook or Apple Mac BookPro cool and avoids overheating during long periods of gaming or browsing online
2 USB powered, 110mm fans with power switch design is so simple to use, no mains power connection needed. 1 extra USB port for an additional USB device.
Slim, portable and lightweight, easy for you to carry around; Led indicator at the rear helps to confirm the cooler is active.
Quiet and Ergonomic Comfort: Angled to place your computer in the best position to use and create a more comfortable experience
Compatibility: Support various laptop sizes from 12 to 16 inches, such as Apple Macbook Pro, Air, HP, Alienware, Dell, Lenovo, ASUS, etc

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,923 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
